roleset.name: to set apart, (causing to be) solitary
roleset.note: ISOLATE-V NOTES: Based on WSJ; adjectival 'isolated' based on BOLT-6. Member of Vncls concealment-16, classify-29.10. (from isolate.01-v)
ISOLATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, isolate.01. Corresponds to Vncls concealment-16, classify-29.10. (from isolation.01-n)
ISOLATED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from isolated.01-j)

role.descr: entity that patient was isolated from

example.name: isolate-v: transitive
example.text: Immunex Corp. said [0] its scientists isolated a molecule which may hold potential as a treatment for disruptions of the immune-system , ranging from organ-transplant rejection , to allergies and asthma .
example.arg: a molecule which may hold potential as a treatment for disruptions of the immune-system , ranging from organ-transplant rejection , to allergies and asthma

example.name: isolate-v: isolate from
example.text: Even today , [the animals]-1 are isolated [*-1]from human interference as tourism here is restricted.

example.name: isolate-v: with GOL
example.text: So he isolated them into small spaces the size of a crate, but still they stayed alive.
example.arg: into small spaces the size of a crate

example.name: isolated-j
example.text: Even if they get nukes iran are still heavily outmanned , outgunned and isolated .

example.name: isolation-n: ar1
example.text: 2 . Further isolation of North Korea : Republicans did not respond well to Obama s food for demilitarization program .

example.name: isolation-n: args 1, 2
example.text: Here we describe its isolation from human platelets by a procedure involving ionic exchange chromatography and affinity chromatography on lactose-agarose.
example.arg: by a procedure involving ionic exchange chomotography and affinity chromatography on lactose-agarose
